Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of tax cuts on the middle class by stating that it will spread prosperity to all taxpayers, which contradicts the report from the Tax Policy Center that shows some individuals will experience an increased tax rate.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to back up the assertion that the tax reform package will benefit all taxpayers, as the report from the Tax Policy Center shows that a percentage of individuals will experience a tax increase.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that reducing tax rates will automatically lead to prosperity for the middle class, without providing evidence or addressing potential alternative explanations.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the impact of tax cuts on the middle class, such as the potential for increased government debt or the potential for wealthier individuals to benefit more from the tax cuts.
